Description: Small white terracotta human head with eyes, nose, mouth, ears, and hair indicated. There are visible dark pores throughout the head. The face is flat. The head has short curly hair. The head is broken at the chin and affixed to a black painted wooden base with a dark gray adhesive filler. The base is trapezoidal, with 1334" in red ink on the bottom. Handmade.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Spurlock Museum, University of Illinois. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.288) (Phase 3)
